017
018package com.github.tommyettinger.tantrum.jdkgdxds;
019
020import com.github.tommyettinger.ds.EnumFloatMap;
021import com.github.tommyettinger.tantrum.digital.helpers.Support;
022import org.apache.fury.Fury;
023import org.apache.fury.memory.MemoryBuffer;
024import org.apache.fury.memory.Platform;
025import org.apache.fury.serializer.Serializer;
026
027/**
028 * Fury {@link Serializer} for jdkgdxds {@link EnumFloatMap}s.
029 */
030public class EnumFloatMapSerializer extends Serializer<EnumFloatMap> {
031
032    public EnumFloatMapSerializer(Fury fury) {
033        super(fury, EnumFloatMap.class);
034    }
035
036    @Override
037    public void write(final MemoryBuffer output, final EnumFloatMap data) {
038        output.writePrimitiveArrayWithSize(data.values().toArray(), Platform.FLOAT_ARRAY_OFFSET, data.size() << 2);
039        for(Enum<?> v : data.keySet()){
040            fury.writeRef(output, v);
041        }
042        output.writeFloat32(data.getDefaultValue());
043    }
044
045    @Override
046    public EnumFloatMap read(MemoryBuffer input) {
047        float[] vs = Support.readFloatsAndSize(input);
048        final int len = vs.length;
049        Enum<?>[] ks = new Enum<?>[len];
050        for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
051            ks[i] = (Enum<?>)fury.readRef(input);
052        }
053
054        EnumFloatMap data = new EnumFloatMap(ks, vs);
055        data.setDefaultValue(input.readFloat32());
056        return data;
057
058    }
059}
